decks.notes: The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and generating advantage with cards like Ephemerate and Tune the Narrative. The deck also includes a mix of creature removal, card draw, and land base to provide flexibility and consistency in handling various threats in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, backed up by burn spells and support cards to clear the way and deal direct damage to the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with versatile cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional support for the aggressive strategy, making this a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck revolves around quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo by using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to tutor for key pieces like Ghalta and Griselbrand. The combo is supported by cards like Generous Ent and Xenagos, God of Revels to pump up creatures and provide additional win conditions. The deck also includes protection spells and mana ramp to ensure the combo can be executed effectively while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and fast combo strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to leverage the Dredge mechanic alongside powerful spells and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through incremental advantage. By utilizing graveyard recursion and manipulation, the deck aims to outvalue its opponent while also disrupting their plays with counter magic and removal spells. This combination of graveyard synergy, control elements, and card advantage allows the deck to grind out wins and overpower opponents in the long game.

The main idea of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost artifact creatures and use cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to generate mana quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Signal Pest and Ornithopter to create a wide presence on the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble to help maintain card advantage and keep the pressure up. Finally, Urza's Saga and Pithing Needle provide additional support and disruption to control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycle creatures and cascade spells to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures. Once there are enough creatures in the graveyard, the player can cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. The deck's key strategy is to cycle through the deck, control the opponent's board with counterspells and removal, and then unleash a massive wave of creatures to overwhelm the opponent in a single turn.

Generating a storm of spells to quickly build up mana and draw through your deck, this deck aims to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to generate lethal amounts of damage using Grapeshot. The deck utilizes cards like Ruby Medallion, Ral, Monsoon Mage, and rituals to accelerate mana production, while also employing card draw and filtering effects to dig for combo pieces. By carefully sequencing spells and managing resources effectively, this deck can execute its combo quickly and overwhelm opponents with a powerful storm of spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by efficient burn spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to clear the way and deal direct damage. The deck aims to aggressively pressure the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card selection and filtering to maintain momentum. Violent Urge and Slickshot Show-Off offer additional combat tricks and removal options, while Mutagenic Growth can help protect key threats or push through extra damage.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards like Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate the mana production and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes control elements such as Kozilek's Return and Ugin's Labyrinth to control the opponent's board and disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with giant Eldrazi threats while maintaining control of the game through resource denial and disruptive spells. It combines the ramp and control strategies to create a powerful and versatile game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays paired with burn spells to control the board. The key strategy is to establish early board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to opposing creatures or the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah can buff your creatures and provide a way to finish off the opponent. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and control elements like Static Prison, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using the powerful Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to quickly ramp up mana and cast big threats like Karn, the Great Creator, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storm. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command for removal, as well as Sire of Seven Deaths for additional win conditions, this deck aims to dominate the board and take control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure through aggressive creatures. Cards like Solitude and Thoughtseize help control the opponent's resources, while creatures like Flickerwisp and Emperor of Bones deliver fast damage. The deck also includes a mix of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes synergies with cards like Ephemerate to gain value and maintain board presence. Ultimately, the deck aims to control and disrupt the opponent while presenting a quick clock to win the game.

The main idea of this deck is to establish control over the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana quickly, allowing for the early deployment of threat cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Thought-Knot Seer. With cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Kozilek's Command, this deck aims to keep opponents on the back foot while maintaining board control. Warping Wail and Chalice of the Void are also included to provide additional disruption options.

This Merfolk deck focuses on aggressive play with a strong tribal synergy. Using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and lord effects like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost them, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures. Water disruption spells like Tide Shaper and Harbinger of the Seas provide control options while maintaining pressure. The inclusion of powerful Merfolk like Mindspring Merfolk and Silvergill Adept ensures card advantage and consistency. Overall, this deck combines speed, disruption, and synergy to dominate the battlefield.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and removal while maintaining card advantage. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and hand disruption spells to control the game, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. The win condition is through powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student providing card draw and Subtlety acting as a versatile threat. The deck also includes a few utility spells like Cling to Dust for graveyard hate. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and quick creature damage to overwhelm opponents. It combines efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls with powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes a few control elements like Elegant Parlor and Thraben Charm to disrupt opponent strategies. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace and keep pressure on opponents while using Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Haliya, Guided by Light to buff and protect creatures for maximum damage output.
